alert.note: Alert for Eastern Currituck (North Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Wakefield (Eastern Virginia and Southern Maryland)
info.headline: High Surf Advisory issued January 04 at 12:39AM EST until January 04 at 5:00AM EST by NWS Wakefield
info.description: ...HIGH SURF ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 5 AM EST EARLY THIS MORNING... * WHAT...Breaking waves of 7 to 11 feet in the surf zone. * WHERE...In Virginia, Virginia Beach. In North Carolina, Eastern Currituck County. * WHEN...Until 5 AM EST early this morning. * IMPACTS...Large breaking waves of 7 to 11 feet will result in dangerous surf conditions. Do not enter or approach the water due to the risk of being swept away.
info.instruction: A High Surf Advisory means that high surf will affect beaches in the advisory area...producing localized beach erosion and dangerous swimming conditions.
